content.raw:
> Sure, each sensor will render one view, but I was imagining that the scene tree of each runner would only include objects which are within a certain range. Are you suggesting that every system that uses ign-rendering will always have the scene tree of the whole world loaded in memory?

I was trying to understand why systems that use ign-rendering have to be moved. A simulation runner would be aware of the level(s) the performer is in and would have loaded all the entities accordingly. Any system that needs ign-rendering has all it needs to create a render without having to be moved to another runner. The system would create a scene tree based on the entities loaded, not the whole world. If another performer happens to be in the same level and it is far enough away that the two performers aren't interacting, the runner would load it without simulating its physics.
